Country.Subdivision: Austria is divided into nine Bundesländer, or simply Länder (states; sing. Land).
Belgium is divided into ten provinces (Flemish: provincies) and one capital region (Flemish: hoofdstedelijke gewest; French: région capitale).
Denmark is divided into five regioner (regions; singular: region) and 98 municipalities (Danish, kommuner).
Finland is divided into five läänit (sing. lääni, Swedish län: provinces) and one itsehallinnollinen maakunta (autonomous province), namely Åland.

France, in Europe and adjacent islands (Corsica), is divided into 96 départements (departments). It also has a number of possessions, some of which are classified as départements d'outre-mer (overseas departments).
Germany is divided into sixteen Länder (sing. Land: state).
Ireland is divided into 26 (traditional) counties.
Italy is divided into 110 province (sing. provincia: provinces).
The Netherlands is divided into twelve provincies (provinces).
Norway is divided into 19 fylker (sing. fylke: counties).
Poland is divided into sixteen wojewodztwa (voivodships).
Portugal is divided into eighteen distritos (districts) and two regiões autônomas (autonomous regions).

Spain is politically organized into 17 Autonomous Communities (comunidades autónomas) and 2 autonomous cities (ciudades autónomas) - Ceuta and Melilla. Administratively Spain also comprises fifty provinces.
Sweden is divided into 21 län (counties).
Switzerland is divided into 26 cantons (French or English), kantone (German), cantoni (Italian), chantuns (Romansh).
Various
Canada is divided into ten provinces and three territories (French: territoires).
Mexico is divided into 31 estados (states) and one distrito federal (federal district).
The United States is divided into fifty states and one federal district.
Australia is divided into six states and four territories.

Japan is divided into 43 ken (prefectures), one to (metropolis - Tokyo), one do (Area - Hokkaido), and two fu (urban prefectures - Kyoto and Osaka). The four words are combined in one, todofuken, to denote a division of any type.
Singapore is divided into five districts.
Argentina is divided into 23 provincias (provinces) and a distrito federal (federal district).

State.StateCapital: San Fernando del Valle de Catamarca

Country.Subdivision: Brazil is divided into 26 estados (states) and one distrito federal (federal district).
Venezuela is divided into 23 estados (states), one dependencias federales (federal dependencies), and one distrito capital (capital district).
